etymologies: early 16th century: from French catarrhe, from late Latin catarrhus, from Greek katarrhous, from katarrhein ‘flow down’, from kata- ‘down’ + rhein ‘flow’

definitions: excessive discharge or buildup of mucus in the nose or throat, associated with inflammation of the mucous membrane.
shortDefinitions: excessive discharge or build-up of mucus in nose or throat, associated with inflammation of mucous membrane
